instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
Hey!

Just got a 15" in. High Fan Spin. Its booting.


Picture:

[ATTACH type="full" alt="mbp15w.jpg"]60434[/ATTACH]



There´s no 15V coming out of my Thunderbolt 15V Boost Regulator.

<TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR> causing it? That chip looking awesome like the indicator.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Did you connect any Thunderbolt device, to need that voltage?

Test the machine disconnecting webcam.
Also run corresponding ASD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
Thank you!

Nothing connected.

ASD - "There may be an issue with SMC"

Orange light while no battery. JTAG connector got corroded...

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is HIGH

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
"ASD - "There may be an issue with SMC""
That is not the full error message!

Do you get <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is present. 3.3V.

Full error message coming...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
I suppose to be the error got starting in Diagnostic mode, not from ASD.

Try first disconnecting the webcam.
If no change, try another trackpad flex/board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
should be some sensor issue...ASD:


one/or more critical sensor error
ERROR - 13005 - loads cpu/gpu - SMC cannot read this sensor
Sensor Failure: 5V Rail Power Highside Faild, Value: 0.700 - had this error 1 time. ASD keeps crashing after a time...


My <SIGNAL>SMC_OTHER5V_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL> is almost nothing - 0.01/0.07v - is here my problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R5426</RESISTOR> and its traces.
Post <CHIP>U5420</CHIP> output voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5420</CHIP> ouput: 0.11V
<RESISTOR>R5426</RESISTOR> is fine, 4.4K

checked also ouput of <CHIP>U5430</CHIP>: 0.09V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
Not sure, but looks very low.
You should compare with good board.
5A is the max current designed for <RESISTOR>R5420</RESISTOR> and the output should be aprox 2.5V in such case.
Considering 2-3A as normal consumption, I'll expect 1-1.5V at <CAPACITOR>C5426</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
just checked. no good board to compare.

same voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5426</CAPACITOR>. Voltage is starting from 0.03 to 0.11 while the fans getting faster.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
No need exact the same board.
Check the equivalent signal on other MacBook Pro board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MacBook Pro 15" High Fan Spin
threads.message:
fixed - was working excellent with a another keyboard / not turning on with water damaged keyboard

ty!
